item.description:
Come join the fun at Nashoba Winery on Sunday, October 26 from 1-5pm for their annual microbrew festival featuring beer, wine, great foliage views, and a bluegrass band called Southern Rail. Feel free to invite as many friends/family as you'd like! (The picture is from last year's event)

It's basically one outdoor party in the orchard. Picnic tables go fast, so bring beach chairs or blankets (we usually try to secure a few tables). It's family-friendly so feel free to bring your kids. Dogs are allowed but must be on a leash. You can take a 30-minute tour of the winemaking facility for $6 (includes souvenir wine glass). There may or may not be apple picking depending on how the weather is the next few weeks.

They have a food tent set up that sells burgers, dogs, Italian sausage, pulled pork, brisket. Side dishes like cole slaw, potato salad, cornbread, and apple crisp. I recommend that you eat before 3:00 as they tend to run out of food early...You can also bring your own picnic baskets and coolers!!! They have a caramel apple stand too.

Their microbrews will be for sale on tap at the outdoor bar and they will also be selling wine/beer by the bottle inside the wineshop all day.

We hope to see you there!

Nashoba Valley Winery
100 Wattaquadock Hill Road
Bolton, MA 01740

Nasoba Winery

Located conveniently off I-495 at Exit 27 (Route 117). Head West 1 mile and turn left at blinking yellow light/Coldwell Banker office. Orchard is approximately 1/8 mile up the road (just follow the traffic).

Best of all its FREE - unless you tour the winery ($6)

Maybe RSVPs allowed for now until we get closer to the event and then only YES and NO RSVPs as we approach the final date.

Thanks,
Jonathan
item.how_to_find_us: For Yes RSVP's I'll send my cell phone number... Come Early - it will be crowded

group.name: Boston Ski, Snowboard, and Outdoor Adventurers Meetup Group

item.name: Nashoba Valley Winery - Microbrew / Bluegrass festival
